definition: to pay up/to shell out/to hand over the money to cover sth
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
lit. one hand exchanges the cash, the other the goods (idiom)/fig. to pay for what you want in cash/simple and direct transaction
pinyin: yi1 shou3 jiao1 qian2 , yi1 shou3 jiao1 huo4

sentences.english: Do you want me to be here when you hand him the money as a witness?
sentences.chinese: 你交钱的时候，要不要我在旁边当个证人？

sentences.english: LanGuiCheng helpless, still have to pay money every month to the red flag.
sentences.chinese: 兰贵成无奈，还是得每个月交钱给文红旗。

sentences.english: The fraternities on campus are a bunch of guys, they make you pay.
sentences.chinese: 学校的兄弟会是一群男学生组成的，他们会要你交钱。

sentences.english: The EC is not paid by Pakistan, so I can be outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 由于巴基斯坦不向欧共体交钱，所以我可以直言不讳。

sentences.english: As soon as the employer ask for money, you can go without hovering.
sentences.chinese: 只要用人单位一说要你交钱，你掉头就走便是了。

sentences.english: If I need to sign the contract and hand in money, how can I contact you?
sentences.chinese: 如果要签合同和交钱，我怎样联系你们？

sentences.english: Please go to the cashier next door to pay the bill.
Please say at the cashier's desk. It's over there.
sentences.chinese: 请到收款台交钱，就在那儿里。

sentences.english: Thank you . Will you pay at the desk , please ? Anything else ?
sentences.chinese: 多谢。请到收款台交钱。还要别的吗？

sentences.english: Empires cost money, and subjects must pay.
sentences.chinese: 帝国需要钱，臣服者必须交钱。

definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
